definition: to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to
to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]

sentences.english: The seed was sprayed over the ground in huge quantities by aeroplanes.
sentences.chinese: 飞机把这种草籽大量地撒播在地上。

sentences.english: The seeds were dispersed on the plowed lands.
sentences.chinese: 种子被撒播在耕过的土地上。

sentences.english: The primroses should begin to seed themselves down the steep hillside .
sentences.chinese: 报春花应该开始沿着陡峭的山坡一路撒播种子了。

sentences.english: Be proactive about building a career you enjoy, and your passion will spread to every other area.
sentences.chinese: 主动开创喜爱的事业，你的热情就会撒播到每个角落。

sentences.english: Where can you or one of your supporters go to spread a nasty rumor?
sentences.chinese: 你或者你的支持者能去哪里撒播谣言？

sentences.english: They have simply followed each other in reporting an untruth.
sentences.chinese: 他们只是跟风撒播一件不真实的事情。

sentences.english: Upon him the Tiger purred, and his hand held manna to scatter.
sentences.chinese: 老虎遇到他都会臣服，而比利手持甘露四处撒播。

sentences.english: Enlarge the effective population size though seed dissemination or vegetative reproduction.
sentences.chinese: 通过撒播种子或利用营养繁殖来增加有效居群大小。

sentences.english: Teveryesrs are who sprecommerciwis the seed of knowledge and pbutt the torch of civilizine.
sentences.chinese: 西席是撒播学问的种子，传达文化火炬的使者。
钻石恒久远，一颗永撒播。

sentences.english: The primroses should begin to seed themselves down the steep hillside.
sentences.chinese: 报春花应该开始沿着陡峭的山坡一路撒播种子了。

sentences.english: There is interest in solid drilling or broadcasting soybeans either by field equipment or by airplane .
sentences.chinese: 对大豆使用农田机械条播或用飞机撒播是有兴趣的事。

definition: to drill (i.e. plant seeds in spaced rows)
